title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro was called up to play for the Bruins after Joonas Korpisalo left the game with an injury scare.
Korpisalo returned after 6:03 of ice time, stopping 36 of 38 shots in the Bruins' 4-2 win over Columbus.
Jeremy Swayman, fresh from winning an Olympic gold, was given additional practice time by coach Marco Sturm.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, was charged with reckless second-degree murder for her baby's death in Manchester, N.H., last year.
The infant, known as 'Baby Jane Doe,' was discovered deceased in Pine Island Pond on March 27, 2025.
Investigators received 50 leads and increased the reward to $5,000 for information on the baby's death.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2006 Mazda3 owner with 66,000 miles had black transmission fluid drained and refilled; advised to do another drain.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek dealer quote includes $890 for four TPMS sensors and $725 for control arm bushing replacement.
Owners should monitor antifreeze levels in a 2018 GMC Denali 1500 pickup as water in antifreeze can evaporate.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham was evacuated due to roof stress from heavy snow accumulation.
Students and staff were relocated to Hingham High School as a precaution.
Hingham received over 17 inches of snow during Monday's blizzard, prompting structural assessments.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz changes stance on Rafael Devers after previous criticism of his defense and fitness.
Former Red Sox star Rafael Devers was traded to the Giants amidst tensions with Boston management in 2025.
Ortiz now expresses support for Devers, citing respect and belief in his continued success in baseball.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gas leak identified as cause of explosion and fire at 78 Plain St., Taunton, displacing eight residents.
A 25-year-old mother and her 2-year-old daughter were severely injured, hospitalized at Rhode Island and Hasbro hospitals.
Over $33,000 raised for injured family; community fundraisers support multiple residents affected by the Taunton explosion.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots ranked 26th out of 32 teams in 2026 NFLPA report card, an improvement from previous years.
The team earned poor marks for travel resources, with the team plane ranked last in the league.
A new facility set to open in 2026 aims to address issues with training and practice fields.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, a 54-year-old Malden teacher and coach, was arraigned on charges including two counts of rape and indecent assault.
The victim, an 18-year-old student, was in Marino's foster care at the time of the alleged assault on February 18.
Marino, released on $75,000 bail, was ordered not to contact the victim or leave Massachusetts, and he has a hearing on April 16.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: State Police Sergeant Joel Daoust was charged with assault and battery after a January traffic stop in Springfield.
Daoust allegedly used physical force and pepper spray on a driver stopped for speeding and lane violations.
State Police suspended Daoust without pay; his arraignment is scheduled for April 3 in Springfield District Court.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey's plan to introduce an AI assistant in the Massachusetts executive branch draws significant criticism.
65% of over 100 readers oppose the AI initiative, citing privacy, security, and environmental concerns.
Healey emphasizes AI's potential to increase government efficiency and offers free Google AI training for all residents.
